channel.title: Comments on: 9 Lives
channel.description: Scattered pages from an apocryphal diary

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: Phoenix has been recommended to me, but I haven't read it. I'm not as familiar with his manga as I am his anime, and even then I haven't seen a lot of it.
item.content:encoded: Phoenix has been recommended to me, but I haven’t read it. I’m not as familiar with his manga as I am his anime, and even then I haven’t seen a lot of it.

item.title: By: Smarty
item.dc:creator: Smarty
item.description:
Sounds interesting... I just started a great series about a group of misfit Buddhist students who decide to start a business seeking revenge for corpses they find: "Kurosagi Corpse Delivery Service."
Have you read Osuma Tezuka's "Buddha" or "Phoenix" series? They are some of my other favorite non-shojo stuff.
item.content:encoded:
Sounds interesting… I just started a great series about a group of misfit Buddhist students who decide to start a business seeking revenge for corpses they find: “Kurosagi Corpse Delivery Service.”

Have you read Osuma Tezuka’s “Buddha” or “Phoenix” series? They are some of my other favorite non-shojo stuff.

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: While I do enjoy manga, I don't actively seek it out. That being said, I'm currently reading Samurai Crusader written by Hiroi Oji and illustrated by Ryoichi Ikegami (Crying Freeman, Sanctuary). It is a wonderful romp around the world and features Ernest Hemingway, Pablo Picasso, a cat burglar, robots, ninjas and the titular samurai.
item.content:encoded: While I do enjoy manga, I don’t actively seek it out. That being said, I’m currently reading Samurai Crusader written by Hiroi Oji and illustrated by Ryoichi Ikegami (Crying Freeman, Sanctuary). It is a wonderful romp around the world and features Ernest Hemingway, Pablo Picasso, a cat burglar, robots, ninjas and the titular samurai.

item.title: By: Smarty
item.dc:creator: Smarty
item.description:
Oh, I've read a lot of manga - all different types. I tend to stick to the shojo stuff, though, because I'm a sucker for romance. That one reason I love Bollywood so much, too!
Do you need recommendations?
item.content:encoded:
Oh, I’ve read a lot of manga – all different types. I tend to stick to the shojo stuff, though, because I’m a sucker for romance. That one reason I love Bollywood so much, too!

Do you need recommendations?

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description:
I don't know about "pertinent facts," but the take home message was that you know a ton more about Bollywood films than I could ever hope to!
I'm intrigued that you read manga (or at least you've read one manga).
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know about “pertinent facts,” but the take home message was that you know a ton more about Bollywood films than I could ever hope to!

I’m intrigued that you read manga (or at least you’ve read one manga).

item.title: By: Smarty
item.dc:creator: Smarty
item.description: Did you learn any pertinent facts about Bollywood or my slow social life?
item.content:encoded: Did you learn any pertinent facts about Bollywood or my slow social life?

item.title: By: Monica
item.dc:creator: Monica
item.description:
It's interesting to me also that the film was directed and written by a man.
Hope the program is moving forward, and many ideas are flowing your way!!!
item.content:encoded:
It’s interesting to me also that the film was directed and written by a man.

Hope the program is moving forward, and many ideas are flowing your way!!!

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description: Well, I've read your blog in the past, so I guess it is only fair.
item.content:encoded: Well, I’ve read your blog in the past, so I guess it is only fair.

item.title: By: Smarty
item.dc:creator: Smarty
item.description: Oh, good. Now I can read all the latest Drey gossip without feeling guilty. :D
item.content:encoded: Oh, good. Now I can read all the latest Drey gossip without feeling guilty. ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description:
I don't mind at all, Smarty. My blog is there to be read.
I guess by "women's issues," I mean the complex network of needs, desires and circumstances they face in relationships as well as the many roles they are called on to play in life. My definition also includes the physicality of being a woman and what sometimes goes along with that (pregnancy, breast cancer, birth control, etc.). I also include their perception and treatment by men.
item.content:encoded:
I don’t mind at all, Smarty. My blog is there to be read.

I guess by “women’s issues,” I mean the complex network of needs, desires and circumstances they face in relationships as well as the many roles they are called on to play in life. My definition also includes the physicality of being a woman and what sometimes goes along with that (pregnancy, breast cancer, birth control, etc.). I also include their perception and treatment by men.
